newsitem.title: USA: Cisco Systems to acquire Granite Systems for $220 million.
newsitem.headline: Cisco Systems to acquire Granite Systems for $220 million.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc. said Tuesday it signed a definitive agreement to acquire privately held Granite Systems Inc. for about $220 million in stock.
Cisco said it was acquiring Palo Alto, Calif.-based Granite Systems for its high-speed and multilayer switching technologies, which Cisco will incorporate into its Internet and intranet software.

The company said Granite's multilayer switching and "Gigabit Ethernet" technology will help reduce congestion on computer networks due to increased users, new applications, such as multimedia, Internet access and groupware, and new high-performance servers.
It said Gigabit Ethernet switching can move data as quickly as one billion bits per second.
Cisco said the stock transaction, which will be accounted for as a pooling of interests, is expected to be completed by October, following regulatory and stockholder approval.
Granite Systems' 50 employees, headed by co-founder Andy Bechtolsheim, will become part of Cisco Systems' Workgroup Business Unit, Cisco said.
Cisco's stock fell $1.50 to $51.25 in early trading on the Nasdaq market.
